data.title: Could VSCode use "region" just like visual studio or in next version?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

In visual studio we can use region like that:

```
//region region-desc

//endregion
```

It can be used in jetbrains idea also:
## ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6395714/18612688/0cb30d8a-7d93-11e6-889d-171eac09a539.png)
## ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6395714/18612702/591bbf0a-7d93-11e6-91c8-7e45bb9d49fd.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6395714/18612691/1f313158-7d93-11e6-8d76-26727b4c6098.png)

Can VSCode use this? That's really a nice feture right?

Steps to Reproduce:

2. Type "Hello World"
3. Select first "l" (3rd letter)
4. Use shortcut "Ctrl + D" to select second "l" (4th letter)

data.title: User Snippets multiple same name variables maintain multiple cursor positions on completion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create user snippet with multiple variables of same name
2. Use the snippet
3. Press enter to complete while editing the variable that has multiple locations
4. VSCode maintains multiple cursor positions at all of the locations of the variable

After completing a user snippet there should only be one cursor position

data.title: Erratic debug value hover preview
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win 10

When breakpoint hit (either node or chrome) - you can hover mouse over the variable (in code editor) and it shows popup with current value.
Very often it stops working - I could not find specific case, same code, same place sometimes works sometimes not.

data.title: Integrated terminal is slow/laggy
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the integrated terminal
2. Type in the console

It works as expected but every character typed in the terminal appear after 0.5~1s. I have the same setup at work but the console is responsive. So there is probably something in my home setup that don't play nicely with the integrated terminal. Note, that if I open a command prompt (or a powershell prompt) outside VSCode the prompt is responsive like I expect it to be. by the way, my computer is more than capable of running VSCode fine. To sum up, the terminal is slow only in VSCode for a reason I don't understand.

data.title: Git quick open should correct invalid branch names
data.body:
Currently whenever you try to checkout to a new branch, using the git quick open,
it will only work as long as your branch name is valid.
if your branch name is invalid you will only get "No other branches".
On this PR I am adjusting this behaviour so vscode will correct any invalid characters from the branch name, and still offer the option of creating a new branch.

Original Behaviour:
![original - invalid branch name](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7824284/18609720/eead199c-7d11-11e6-8981-e7075b334525.png)
New Behaviour:
![after pr - invalid branch name](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7824284/18609719/eea2cfaa-7d11-11e6-8651-c74cfd6a6d76.png)

data.title: Is VSCode compatible with macOS Sierra?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5
- OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download latest VSCode-darwin-stable.zip
2. Unzip the file to create the Visual Studio Code.app
3. Double-click the Visual Studio Code.app icon to open
4. App does not open. App bounces on the dock once or twice, but app does not open.

Alternatively
3a. Will drag Visual Studio Code.app to the Applications folder
4a. Double click the Visual Studio Code.app icon to open
5a. App does not open. App bounces on the dock once or twice, but app does not open.

Is it just my Mac? Is it a compatibility issue with macOS Sierra? Is it a known bug?

Thanks!
- Mike

data.title: Executing tasks inside Bash on Ubuntu on Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 14926

I've set the Integrated Terminal so that it runs Bash on Ubuntu on Windows, which works fine. However, is there a way to run a task in Bash? For example, running a Python file so that it is the equivalent of `python3 <filename>.py` in Bash, as opposed to running in Windows CMD?

data.title: workspace/symbol search stops working after 3 characters entered
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Bring up quick open (ctrl+p)
2. Begin global symbol search by pressing #
3. Enter two characters, a list of symbols appears
4. Enter a third character -> list is not updated, progress bar runs forever
5. Afterwards, workspace symbol search is broken until vscode is restarted.

Additional info:
I could verify that after the bug appears, no workspace/symbol messages are sent to the extensions anymore.

![workspacesymbol](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2094371/18608280/5767a344-7ce5-11e6-9474-88c015a0a74e.gif)

data.title: Allow keybindings to override chord keys when there is a when condition

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (0619ede1e469ed23fbb214eaa0377625a402ca87, 2016-09-16T08:03:24.238Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-31-generic, Ubuntu 16.04

Based on my testing at least on Linux, I cannot bind ctrl+k as a keybinding due to the chord keybindings. This blocks #6603 in allowing a ⌘K keybinding to clear the terminal (`"when": "terminalFocus"`). I think it's reasonable to allow overriding of the chords at the very least when there is a `"when"` condition.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Define a keybinding as ctrl/cmd+k with a `"when"` condition
2. Try using it

data.title: No autocomplete for native JavaScript props and methods
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

Autocomplete for native methods and properties in JavaScript doesn't work inside IIFE (Immediately-Invoked Function Expression).

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Type `document.get` at the top of JS file - you will get 'getElementById` autocomplete suggestion.

![2016-09-17-0dyeh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1612675/18607761/e32f6238-7cde-11e6-9fff-e22aab4e8398.png)

2) Type `document.get` inside IIFE construction - you'll get no autocomplete suggestion for `getElementById`.

``` javascript
(function (window, document) {
  document.get| // no autocomplete
})(window, document)
```

![2016-09-17-gtm7q](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1612675/18607762/ed55e5a2-7cde-11e6-96bb-d15638ff2d42.png)

This looks like an issue, I hope this will be fixed in the next release.

data.title: Enable regular expression case changing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `Ctrl+H`
2. Find camelCase strings `([a-z])([A-Z])`
3. Change it to lowercase `$1-\L$1\E`

expected `fooBar` to be `foo-bar`

data.title: Visual Studion code does not keep the old search results in the search pane or provide a drop down list of previous search phrases.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for any symbol using the search option in VS code IDE. 
2. Search results will be shown in the search results pane.
3. Search for another symbol.
4. Search results for the second search will replace the search results of the first search.
5. It is very annoying because I, as a developer, at many times am interested in following more than one symbol.
   Keeping the previous search results in the same search results pane is very much needed feature.  Newer search results may be listed at the top and previous search results may be listed below the newer results in chronological order.
6. Also please provide a dropdown menu for the search results listing the previous search strings.  Keeping all the search strings in some editor and copying them again and again for searching is very annoying and time consuming.

data.title: getaddrinfo ENOENT in offline Mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start the editor in offline mode , no internet connected
2. and error pop up.

showing information message : `getaddrinfo ENOENT marketplace.visualstudio.com:443`

```
messageService.ts:119getaddrinfo ENOENT marketplace.visualstudio.com:443: Error: getaddrinfo ENOENT marketplace.visualstudio.com:443
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:890:11)
    at errnoException (dns.js:31:15)
    at GetAddrInfoReqWrap.onlookup [as oncomplete] (dns.js:77:26)e.doShow @ messageService.ts:119
threadService.ts:217[Extension Host] Windows_NT
```

data.title: Fix Chinese(Simplified) message translation

In Chinese "重启后生效" is better than "重启后可用".

Then, I fixed missing string `SourceFile` and `AssociateWithFiles`

- OS Version: OS X 10.10 (14A389)

2. Toggle Full Screen

Thanks

data.title: [themes] change the file icon or theme in API
data.body:
**Themes** :
1. Where does code store current applied theme ?
2. Where does code store all installed themes ?
3. How to get them via API in extension ?

**File Icons** :
1. Where does code store current applied file icon ?
2. Where does code store all installed file icons ?
3. How to get them via API in extension ?


_P.S : I need it for my Code Settings Sync extension_
